page.title: 15CHANGES IN LEYBURN
page.content: I interviewed a lady who has lived in Leyburn for 36 years - since she was born.She has lived in her present home, a bungalow, for eight and a half years but has lived in a few other houses in the town during her life. Having been educated in Leyburn she worked locally. When she married she remained in the town as her husband was employed locally. One of the main regrets felt is the closure of the local cinemas of which there were two. The Comprehensive School which was built to accommodate pupils form the age of eleven upwards from the whole dale is looked upon as an improvement to the former system of village schools which educated children from the age of five up to leaving school at sixteen.
